text: hello my name is Fabian Leavitt I am a
Solutions Architect and Amazon Web
Services in this video I'll show you a
short demo of the AWS resource access
manager console
the newest resource access manager or
AWS RAM for sure lets you share your
resources with any AWS account or
through AWS organizations if you have
multiple accounts you can create
resource centrally and use either the
SRAM to share those resources with other
accounts for my example we'll use three
accounts under the same organization the
resource owner account will share a
subnet with the other two accounts this
will let all three release accounts to
launch their applications resources into
a centrally managed be PC the resources
include Amazon ec2 instances Amazon RDS
databases Amazon redshift clusters and
AWS lambda functions if you would like
to share resources with other accounts
in your organization then you must use
the AWS Ram console to enable sharing go
to the AWS Ram console and from the left
menu click settings select enable
sharing within your AWS organization and
click save settings
we are now ready to share the subnet
with other accounts from the left menu
click resource shares click create
resource share provides your name like
share some net and the resources confirm
that you have selected subnets at the
resource type and select one or more
subnets in my example I'm sharing the
private subnet now under principles and
check allow external accounts the
absorption is disabled accounts outside
your organization cannot gain access to
the resources we can see organization
accounts by clicking show organization X
structure we can share the subnet with
individual accounts an entire oh you or
all accounts under the organization in
my case I'll share the subnet with a dev
and prepare all organizational units
you can also have optional tags to the
share and to grade it confirm by
creating resource share let's login to
one of the accounts we share their
subnets with we can see the share some
net under share with me share resources
notice how we are logging into account
ending in 92 for 8 and the subnet owner
is account ending in 2 1 3 6 now for
example for the consumer account we can
launch an ec2 instance in the share
subnet we select an ami select an
instance type and from the instance
details choose the subnet shared with us
in my case I will launch the instance
without a keeper here are some
additional resources to get you started
including the AWS Ram home page
documentation and our cloud security
have thank you
